p: Remdesivir being a nucleoside analog inhibits the viral genome replication process by targeting the RdRp enzyme. After host-dependent conversion to its active form- nucleoside triphosphate (NTP) ( Fig. 18), it incorporates into the RNA strand after fending off Adenosine triphosphate (ATP), the natural nucleotide incorporated in this process resulting in premature termination of RNA synthesis [85], [86], [95]
